thread.title: Facebook Doesn’t Expect Revenue Impact Over Privacy Concerns

author: Stu Woo
title: Facebook Doesn’t Expect Revenue Impact Over Privacy Concerns
text:
LONDON—Facebook Inc. doesn’t expect the recent uproar over its users’ digital privacy to affect sales significantly, a top advertising executive for the global social-media platform said Thursday.
Facebook users largely haven’t changed their privacy settings in the past four weeks amid heightened scrutiny over how it shares individual data, Facebook vice president of global marketing solutions Carolyn Everson said at The Wall Street Journal CEO Council in London. 
... RELATED VIDEO Mark Zuckerberg's Testimony Before Congress: The Highlights Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg was questioned for almost 10 hours by senators and representatives over the company's privacy policies. Here are some of the important moments. Photo: EPA/AFP
